answers.answer: you probably need to take an additional medication at night. what are you taking during the day? usually, your daytime meds cover you during the daylight hours, but at night they aren't there...so taht might be why you're waking up high.

My question is, How high are the morning readings?There is what is known as the "sunrise effect" in some diabetics where blood glucose bumps when you wake up, but if you don't eat and check it 15-30 minutes later, it's normal.I would talk to my doc about it and get a fasting blood glucose lab test, which would let you know more, and let you and your doc know if you do need to bump up your evening med dose.
